subject: Re: Unicode Status
msgSnippet: It s great the way it is.  The concept is to visually identify shapes of words and the differences are enough to confuse a TEA versus PEA while reading. The
messageBody:
It's great the way it is. The concept is to visually identify shapes of words and the differences are enough to confuse a TEA versus PEA while reading.

The submission can certainly go in with the arrangements you outlined. It looks like it was already decided to merge with the Shavian script which makes sense.

We should get the proposal in and can discuss any revisions if the Consortium highlights issues.

Jayson



--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Michael Everson <everson@...> wrote:
>
> I'm not entirely convinced that the unification has been scrutinized sufficiently. Is SHAVIAN QUIKSCRIPT LETTER PEA really a different character from SHAVIAN LETTER PEEP? It sure looks like a glyph variant to me.
>
> Any disunifications are going to need explicit support, because the UTC will press on this issue.
>
> Michael Everson * http://www.evertype.com/
>
